summary: Added recent_form_quality_adjusted_diff feature to distinguish between fighters with similar recent records but vastly different competition levels
rationale: The plan identified that both fighters showed 0.667 recent win rate, but Gaethje's wins came against opponents with avg win rate 0.715 vs Pimblett's 0.515. This quality-adjusted recent form should be a key differentiator for Top 25% confidence predictions. The feature compares recent win rates (last 3-5 fights) while weighting each win/loss by the opponent's quality score. This helps identify true favorites who have proven themselves against elite competition without directly penalizing underdogs, as it focuses on quality-adjusted performance rather than raw win rates.
expected_effect: The feature will help XGBoost distinguish between fighters with similar recent records but different competition levels. For example, a 0.667 win rate against elite opponents (avg win rate 0.715) will score higher than the same win rate against weaker opponents (avg win rate 0.515). This should improve Top 25% confidence accuracy by increasing model confidence for favorites with substantial quality-adjusted recent form advantages, while preserving the model's ability to identify valuable underdog opportunities in closer matchups. The feature is monotone increasing (constraint = 1), ensuring that better quality-adjusted recent form always favors the fighter with the higher score.
